name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Introduction
content: CHITUBOX Basic is a free 3D printing software (slicer) that slices and converts 3D mesh files into printable files. It aims to make 3D printing easier and more efficient, by simplifying the entire 3D printing process, allowing users to quickly and easily convert 3D models into 3D printed parts. The software supports a variety of 3D printing machines and profiles and offers a rich set of options for optimizing 3d print models.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Brand New UI
content: We are excited to announce the launch of CHITUBOX Basic 2 with a brand new user interface, aiming to provide an easier and more intuitive user experience. The improved navigation and layout should better help you locate the tools and functions you need. We also added a range of new features, including themes, improved object handling, and more. With our new UI, your 3D printing experience will be faster, more efficient, and more enjoyable.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Support for DirectX and Metal
content: By supporting DirectX and Metal, CHITUBOX Basic can now render more realistic and complex 3D models, with more detail and more realistic lighting, shadows, and Fresnel effect. These technologies also improve performance, allowing you to fully leverage the power of your graphics card. You can now experience the highest level of graphical performance on Windows and macOS platforms when working with CHITUBOX Basic.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: RMA
content: We are excited to announce the launch of our new RMA (Resin Material Alliance) feature. This feature allows you to easily select the appropriate settings for different brands of resin materials. It also supports cloud storage. So you can access your settings from anywhere. Additionally, the library is constantly being updated to provide the latest configurations. With RMA, you can now quickly and easily set up your printer for optimal 3D printing results.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Quick Start
content: This section will guide you through the basic usage of CHITUBOX helping you to get started quickly. We will start by loading a model, and then add supports, slice the model, and finally export the printable file to your printer.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Add a printer
content: You will need to add the printer you need when you first launch CHITUBOX. Taking ELEGOO Jupiter as an example: click the plus button  on the machine management bar, and select ELEGOO Jupiter from the list. Click 'Next'. Here you can change the configurations of the printer. We will use the default settings for convenience. Click 'Apply'.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Load Files
content: You can load existing files into CHITUBOX via the dialog window or by dragging and dropping the file into CHITUBOX. Let's try opening a file through the dialog window. Click the menu button on the upper left corner of the main window. If you want to load up an existing project, click Open Project. If you want to open a 3D mesh file instead, click Open.... You can click ðŸ”—this link (https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/introduction#supported-file-formats) to see the supported 3D mesh file types. Select a 3D mesh file you want to slice from your computer.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Add Supports
content: Without supports, a model will likely fail to print successfully with only a single point on the build plate. And the model will be very unstable state as the model's center of gravity is above the contact point. Click the support icon  on the upper right corner of the main window to enter the support configuration window. We will use auto-support here for simplicity. Click the 'Auto Support' button. Great! Now we're can go ahead to slice the file.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Slicing
content: Click the file configuration button  in the upper right corner to get back to the main window. Then click the 'Slice' button in the lower right corner to slice the file. This process takes some time, depending on the size of the model and the complexity of the supports.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Exporting the Printable File
content: This is the final step. Click the 'Save' button in the lower right to open up the save slice file window.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Gadgets
content: In this section, we will introduce some useful gadgets in CHITUBOX.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Toolbar
content: The toolbar is located on the left side of the main window. It contains five tools: select, move, rotate, scale, and mirror.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Select
content: The toolbar is located on the left side of the main window. It contains five tools: select, move, rotate, scale, and mirror.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Move
content: The move tool is used to move selected models. Move objects precisely by entering coordinates in the move panel. Put on the plate: Place the selected model on the print platform based on its lowest point. Cetered: Center the selected model on the print platform. Multiple objects within selection will be centered based on the center of the group.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Rotate
content: Rotate selected models. Rotate objects precisely by entering angles in the rotate panel. Combination Center: Rotate around the center of the group of selected models. Flatten by face: Place the model on the platform based on the selected face. Auto-orient selected models based on built-in algorithm.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Scale
content: Scale selected models. Scale objects precisely by inputting the scale size or ratio in the scale panel. Global coordinate: Scale handles are parallels to the global coordinates. Local coordinate: Scales handle are parallel to the model's local coordinates. Reset: Reset the scale to 100%. Lock Ratio: If enabled, the X, Y and Z dimentioned will be scaled proportionally. Lock support diameter: If enabled, the support diameter will not be scaled.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Mirror
content: Mirror selected models on the platform. Keep the original model: Preserve the original model in the mirror action.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Info Panel
content: The Info Panel is located in the lower left of the main window. It contains basic information of current print settings.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Machine Management Bar
content: The Machine Management Bar is located at bottom of the main window. Here you can add, delete, and copy printers. Click the add machine button to add a new printer. Click the menu icon, and you can see options to Hide Platform, Copy Machine, and Delete Machine.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Support Display Mode
content: Click to switch to the support view. There are 3 buttons allowing you to switch between different support display modes.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Render Mode
content: Rending mode options are located in the upper right of the main window. It contains two modes: Details and Fresnel. In Details mode, the model shows more details on the surface. In Fresnel mode, the model appears smoother on the surface.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Viewport Gizmos
content: Viewport Gizmos are located in the upper right corner of the main window, providing an intuitive way to quickly manipulate the view, enabling users to quickly change the angle or perspective of the viewport, and facilitating the inspection of the relative position of objects. The Home  icon and the Perspective/Orthographic icons are located at the upper-right of the main window, next to the viewport gizmos. The Home icon allows users to reset the viewport to the default view. The Perspective/Orthographic icon allows users to switch between Perspective and Orthographic views. Perspective mode provides a more realistic view of the scene, while Orthographic mode gives users a flat view of the scene. Changing the view model can help users to assess the position of objects on the build plate and make adjustments as needed.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Slider
content: The slider is located at the right of the main window, used to preview the sectional area of models (pre-slice) and layers of models (post-slice). The slider has two buttons on the top and bottom for animating the slider position. The reset button on the bottom resets the slider position to the default levels. The slider component can help users assess the quality of the 3D model before it is sent to the printer, allowing them to make adjustments as needed.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Operations
content: Various Operation Options are located at the top of the main window, including Open, Save, Copy, Auto Layout, Hollow, Dig Hole, Repair, Standard Parts, Resin Material Alliance, Notifications and Account Management.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Open
content: Open 3D mesh files, .chitubox project files, or slice files.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Save
content: Save your current project to a .chitubox file or a 3D mesh file.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Auto Layout
content: The Auto Layout function gives users multiple options to quickly and easily position 3D models on the print platform, including center of the build plate, near the X side of the build plate, and near the Y side of the build plate.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Hollow
content: The Hollow function has 2 modes: 'Hollow out' and 'Peel'. Hollow out allows users to create 3D models with hollow interiors, while retaining the outer shape of the model. The Hollow option can help users save time and material costs when printing 3D models, as the hollow interior will require less material to print. This feature can also be used to create lightweight models with a complex outer shape. Peel will peel off a designated thickness of wall from the model, just like shrinking the model down.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Hollow Parameters Explained
content: Wall Thickness: wall thickness determines the overall thickness of the walls. Precision: Density of the generated triangles. A value of 0 represents the minimum density, and 1 represents the maximum. Infill Structure: Pattern of the infill. Infill Density: Density of the infill. Animation: enabling this option will show the hollowing process.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Dig Hole
content: The 'Hole' function allows users to create holes of specified shape or size in a 3D model with just a few clicks.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Hole Parameters Explained
content: Shape: The shape of the hole; available shapes are Circular, Hexagon, and Square. Diameter: The diameter of the hole. Depth: The maximum thickness of the wall that the hole can penetrate. Perpendicular to: Choose the digging angle: perpendicular to the screen or to the model. Keep the cork: Whether to Keep the hole plug.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Repair
content: The Repair function will try to fix broken models. The repair function may not function correctly if the model is complex or has a lot of errors like inverted normals, overlapping faces, etc.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Standard Parts
content: Standard Parts provides users with a library of pre-made 3D models that can be quickly and easily imported into their project, including a various basic geometries, testing models, tool models, mechanical parts, and more.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Resin Material Alliance
content: Users can access Material Center here.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Notifications
content: Users can view notifications from CHITUBOX here.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Login
content: Users can log in to their CHITUBOX account. After logging in, users can access their settings from the cloud.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: File List
content: All loaded files are displayed in the file list. You can select multiple files at the same time or select all files by clicking the select all button. Click the checkbox icon to select/deselect the file. Click the eye icon display/hide the file. Click the add icon to add files. Click the ruler icon  to display the the bounding box dimension of all files. Click the trash icon to delete the selected files.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Cavity Detection
content: Collision detection is located on the right side of the main panel, below the file list panel. Collision detection helps users highlight collisions in their 3D printing model, allowing users to adjust the model to avoid collisions.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Suspension Detection
content: Suspension Detection is available in the support view. Click  to switch to the support view. Suspension Detection is located on the right side of the support view right below the support list panel. Suspension Detection function helps users identify any unsupported high-risk areas in their 3D printing model, allowing users to add supports to the model to avoid print failure. It offers three accuracy levels: Low, Medium, and High. Higher accuracy levels produce more accurate detections result, but take longer to finish detection. Click the 'Refresh' button  to refresh the detection result. Click the arrow in the Suspended Area panel to navigate through the detected overhangs and zoom into the corresponding area of the model.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Island Detection
content: Island Detection is similar to Suspension Detection but detects islands by iterating 2D layers instead of 3D models. To use Island Detection, slice the model first by clicking the Slice button on the right side of the main panel below the file list panel. After slicing the model, you will enter the preview window and see the Detect Islands and the Delete Islands buttons at the top of the preview window. Detect Islands will detect islands in the model and highlight them in red in the preview viewport. Delete All Islands will delete all detected islands. Typlically you would not use this function but go back to add supports to the islands. Click the Delete Islands button on the right of the main panel to delete islands on a specific layer.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Configure Print Parameters
content: Before setting the print parameters, add a new printer by clicking the add button  on the machine management bar located at the bottom of the main window. Choose a printer brand to expand the available printers, and then select the printer you want to add. Click the Next button to add the printer. You can then configure print parameters for the added printer. One printer can have multiple profiles, which you can manage in the Profile Panel. In the Profile Panel you can  download profiles (from RMA or custom library),  upload all profiles (to custom library),  add a profile,  import profiles (from local),  export all profiles (to local). By hovering each configuration's menu icon, you can see the available operations for the configuration, including  upload,  rename,  export,  reset,  delete.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Machine
content: Here you can configure the printer's basic information, including the printer's name, machine resolution, dimensions, etc.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Name
content: The printer's name, editable, printer model type by default.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Type
content: The model of the printer, not editable.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Mirror
content: Exposure image mirror mode. You do not need to change this setting in most circumstances unless you are using the default printer type (Other > default).

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Resolution and Size
content: The resolution and size of the print screen. You do not need to change this setting in most circumstances unless you are using the default printer type (Other > default). The Link/Unlink buttons  allow you to link/unlink the size and resolution or X and Y. Any linked value will be updated automatically when the other value is changed. If dimensions are not linked to the resolution (resolution stays unchanged), the smaller the screen size, the larger the actual print will be, and vice versa.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Build Area Offset
content: The offset of the build area. Enabling this option allows the adjustment of the offset to the edge of the print screen. Offset areas will not print. This option can be used to avoid bad points on the edge.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Resin
content: Here you can configure data for the resin you are using, including the resin's name, type, density, unit price, etc. CHITUBOX will use this information to calculate the resin usage and cost.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Print
content: Check out all print parameters here: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/ui-and-features/configure-print-parameters#print

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: TSMC (Two-Stage Motion Control)
content:
Migrating from Anycubic Photon Workshop? Heads up! * Because Anycubic Photon Workshop offers both Basic and Advanced settings, and CHITUBOX's format lacks a dedicated field to differentiate them, CHITUBOX only displays Basic parameters for printers that do not support Advanced settings. Conversely, CHITUBOX displays only Advanced parameters for printers that support both settings. If your printer supports Advanced settings but you do not want to use the TSMC feature, simply enter the same speed for both stages, and ensure the total lift distance is consistent with the desired distance. * The order of TSMC parameters in the UI is different. In Photon Workshop, [0] refers to the motion stage closer to the screen, while [1] represents the stage farther away. However, CHITUBOX follows the motion order in layout input boxes. There are two sets of lifting and retracting parameters in the print settings, where you can set up TSMC. 
 There are two sets of lifting and retracting parameters in the print settings, where you can set up TSMC. When the build plate starts lifting with the model, the FEP film at the bottom of the resin vat will pull down the newly solidified layer until it is detached from the layer. This is called the 'suction effect'. The suction effect is more prominent when the contact area with the FEP film is large and when the build plate pulls away at higher speeds. The suction effect can cause the model to deform, and even cause the model to fall off the build plate. We recommend keeping the lifting speed slow until the model is detached from the FEP film. As the suction effect is no longer a concern, speeding up the lifting speed afterwards can improve the printing efficiency. The principle acts similarly in the retracting stage. You can adjust the following parameters below to get familiar with TSMC: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/ui-and-features/configure-print-parameters#tsmc-two-stage-motion-control

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Picture Grayscale
content: Picture Grayscale is similar to Light PWM, ranging from 0 to 255. But picture Grayscale controls the light transmittance of the LCD screen Instead of the power of the UV light source.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Picture Grayscale
content: Picture Grayscale is similar to Light PWM, ranging from 0 to 255. But picture Grayscale controls the light transmittance of the LCD screen Instead of the power of the UV light source.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Anti-Aliasing
content: There are two anti-aliasing modes: Gray Scale Level and Anti-aliasing Level (legacy).

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Gray Scale Level
content: This mode is designed for the .ctb format. Grayscale level: Range: 0 ~ 255. 0 stands for black, 255 stands for white. Determines the gray range available for anti-aliasing. Image Blur Pixel: Available values: 2 ~ 8. Determines the number of pixels for edge transition. A higher value setting results in softer edges. It is similar to the feather function in Photoshop.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Anti-aliasing Level
content: This is the legacy mode, designed for the .cbddlp format only. Anti-aliasing Level: Available values: 2, 4, 8. It determines the edge exposure time. The higher the level you select, the longer the exposure time, resulting in sharper edges and decreasing the anti-aliasing effects.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Shrinkage Compensation
content: Model shrinkage compensation in the X, Y, and Z directions as a percentage of the original model size. The default value is 100%. Large percentage value results in larger model entities and vice versa.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Tolerance Compensation
content: Inner and outer diameter compensation of normal printing layers. When a is larger, the inner diameter is shorter, and the model body is larger. When a is smaller, the inner diameter is longer, and the model body is smaller. When b is larger, the outer diameter is longer, and the model body is larger. When b is smaller, the outer diameter is shorter, and the model body is smaller. https://youtu.be/iYKVPmmoUUo

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Bottom Tolerance Compensation
content: Inner and outer diameter compensation of bottom printing layers. This setting is often enabled to address the 'elephant's foot' issue. When a is larger, the inner diameter is shorter, and the model body is larger. When a is smaller, the inner diameter is longer, and the model body is smaller. When b is larger, the outer diameter is longer, and the model body is larger. When b is smaller, the outer diameter is shorter, and the model body is smaller. Note: 1.When the bottom layer tolerance compensation is disabled, the normal layer tolerance compensation will be effective for the whole model. 2.Bottom Tolerance Compensation only applies to bottom layers. Enabling both layer transition and Bottom Tolerance compensation can lead to unexpected printing results.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Print Time Compensation
content: Some high-resolution printers can have extra delays when loading data and will lead to inaccurate printing time estimation. You can set up a time compensation to improve the issue. * Manual Input Layer Print Time Compensation: a 2-digit number between -99.99 and 99.99, with default set at 0 s. When enabled, the Estimated Time For A Single Layer = Exposure Time + Waiting Time + Movement Time + Layer Print Time Compensation * Auto Generation

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Z Lift Height
content: The height distance between the lowest point of the model and the platform. The default value is 5mm.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Support Settings
content: Here you can import, export, and reset support settings. CHITUBOX Provides 3 default support settings: Light, Medium, and Heavy. You can also create customized support settings and export them for future use.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Tip Upper Diameter
content: Diameter for the tip of supports.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Raft Shape
content: Available options: Skate, Cross grid.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Touch Tip Distance
content: Touch Tip Distance is the distance between the tips of supports, controlling the density of supports.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Support Angle
content: The maximum angle (degrees) between the model surface (tangent plane) and the platform for auto-support to generate.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Advanced Settings
content: Advanced settings contain settings for four segments: Top, Middle, Bottom, and Raft.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Top
content: Check out this table for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/ui-and-features/configure-support-parameters#top

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Middle
content: Check out this table for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/ui-and-features/configure-support-parameters#middle

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Bottom
content: Check out this table for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/ui-and-features/configure-support-parameters#bottom

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Raft
content: Check out this table for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-basic/latest/ui-and-features/configure-support-parameters#raft

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Auto Support
content: There are 2 modes for auto support: +All and +Platform. +All allows supports to be generated based on all model surfaces, while +Platform only allows supports to be generated on the platform.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Manual Support Operation
content: Manual Support Operation allows: Add, Delete, and Edit of supports, with corresponding shortcut keys 'A', 'D', and 'E'. Hold down the Ctrl key and drag the mouse to select all supports within the frame and batch Add, Delete and Edit supports.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Add
content: Click the model to add supports. There are two modes for adding supports: Regular (default) and Connection. The Connection mode allows you to add supports between models and existing support trunks, when complying to the following rules: * After first clicking on a model surface, you can click and attach the other end of the support on the same model's surface or an existing support trunk. * After first clicking on a support trunk, you can click and attach the other side of the support on another existing support trunk. In order to use Connection model, pop out the support mode panel first, then select Connection mode on the panel.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Delete
content: Click supports to highlight target supports in red, and then click the button again or press Delete key to delete selected supports.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Edit
content: Click supports to highlight target supports in green, or hold down Ctrl key to select multiple supports. You can then adjust parameters of the selected supports. You can also drag supports to adjust their positions. Under Edit mode, double click a support node to generate support segments originated from the note (press Esc to exit).

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Clear All
content: Delete all supports by clicking this button.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Preview Window
content: After slicing, you can preview the model in the preview window. The preview window is divided into two sections: the left side for model preview, and the right side for layer preview. The Print Settings panel at the bottom of the preview window displays print settings for the current model. You can modify the print settings here before saving the sliced file. You can view the print information the upper right corner of the preview window. Available print information includes the Machine Type, Resin, Volume, Weight, Price, and Print Time.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Network Sending
content: The Network Sending button will be available for printers that support network printing. This feature allows you to directly send sliced data to the printer for printing. Clicking this button to open the Network Sending window. Note: You need to install ChituManager to use the Network Sending function. Click the Network Sending button and follow the prompted steps tp download and install ChituManager.

name: CHITUBOX Basic
title: Save Files
content: After slicing, you can save the sliced file to your computer. Click the Save button on the lower-right side of the preview window to save the sliced file. NOTE: The file saving dialog only shows the file format supported by your printer. If you do not see the correct format from the drop-down menu, please go back and check if you have selected the correct printer. The default printer type allows you to save the sliced file in any format supported by CHITUBOX. However, you should only select the default printer type when your printer does not have a built-in profile in CHITUBOX.

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Issues with the Windows Operating System

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Windows Explorer Keep Repeatedly Restarting
content: If your Windows Explorer keeps restarting, please follow these steps to fix it: Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc to bring up your Windows Task Manager, right-click on Windows Explorer, and then click Restart. In your Task Manager, click File > Run new task, enter `cmd`, check Create this task with administrative privileges, and then click OK. Enter: `regsvr32 /u "{CHITUBOX-Installation-Path}\CHITUBOX_Thumbnail.dll"`, Note that you need to replace {CHITUBOX-Installation-Path} with your CHITUBOX's installation path, for example: `regsvr32 /u "C:\Program Files\ChiTubox\CHITUBOX_Thumbnail.dll"` Hit Enter to run the command. NOTE: Your OpenGL version should not be lower than 2.0.

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Conflicts with Fusion 360 or OpenGL error "Failed to create OpenGL context for format QSurfaceFormat"
content: Check out this link for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/faq/latest/chitubox-basic-faq#conflicts-with-fusion-360-or-opengl-error-failed-to-create-opengl-context-for-format-qsurfaceformat

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: This application failed to start because no Qt platform plugin could be initialized
content: Check out this link for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/faq/latest/chitubox-basic-faq#this-application-failed-to-start-because-no-qt-platform-plugin-could-be-initialized

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: The code execution cannot process because CbdXXXX.dll was not found
content: Installing failure due to a missing CbdXXXX.dll error could be caused by permission issues. Check out this link for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/faq/latest/chitubox-basic-faq#the-code-execution-cannot-process-because-cbdxxxxdll-was-not-found

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: CHITUBOX is Not Responding
content: It is very likely a software conflict issue. Please exit all running software one by one and look for any software that conflicts with CHITUBOX. This should resolve the issue in most cases. The following software might cause conflicts: * Anti-virus software * Tabtip (In Windows Task Manager it is called Touch Keyboard and Handwriting Panel) * PowerToys * Google Drive

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Error 'SSL handshake failed'
content: Authorization code activation may be affected and result in an 'SSL handshake failed' error message if the system time does not match the current actual date. To resolve this issue, you can set the system time automatically (recommended) or manually. Then restart the software and activate the code.

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Longer Error -1
content: 1. Longer's control board process the resolution specially, we have confirmed the correct resolution to be x: 960, y: 1708. We have have carefully checked and confirmed this, so please don't change it. 2. `Error code -1` is an internal error of the plug-in due to changing of the resolution. Download Longer plugin [here](https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/1rPRw68b3Z1oqLwc7hSmP5A9Zx0HjatbE?fbclid=IwAR2XyvSs_jCWwqXymOh9ZEvcuyKNuj-ibnmbLAmfOsZMWzjJdke71kxANwQ).

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Thumbnail Abnormalities
content: Check out this link for detailed information: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/faq/latest/chitubox-basic-faq#thumbnail-abnormalities

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Rough Model Surface after Slicing
content: The displayed surface quality of a sliced model may appear rough. This is because each voxel of the model is rendered after slicing, similarly to zooming into each pixel after of an image in Photoshop. As it is shown in the figure, the height of each voxel is the layer height set in the slice setting. The length of each voxel is the length of each pixel on the screen, while the width of each voxel is the width of each pixel on the screen. A voxel is the smallest unit that constitutes a print. Note: This voxel imaging is not visible upon the initial slice preview. You need to reload the .ctb file in CHITUBOX to view it.

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Why are STL files scaled when imported into CHITUBOX?
content: STL files do not contain specific unit information but use numerical records. Therefore, different software may use different units to read STL files. For example, 1 meter in Blender might equate to 1 millimeter in CHITUBOX. You need to test the scale relationship between your 3D modeling software and CHITUBOX before exporting files.

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: Clear Cache
content: You may encounter other issues caused by data corruption between versions in certain cases. You can try clearing cache: Navigate to the following directory: Windows: `C:\Users\{user-name}\AppData\Local` macOS: `Macintosh HD/Users/{user-name}/Library/Application Support` Ubuntu: `~/.local/share` If you cannot find the AppData or Library folder, they may be hidden. Follow steps below to show hidden files: Windows: Open File Explorer, go to the View tab, and tick the checkbox for Hidden items. macOS: In Finder, navigate to the desired location, and press Command + Shift + . (period key). 2. Close CHITUBOX Basic (make sure to close CHITUBOX Basic first). 3. Ensure that CHITUBOX Basic is closed, find and delete the ðŸ“‚'chitubox2_0' and ðŸ“‚'chituboxResource' folders. 4. Restart CHITUBOX Basic. WARNING: Clearing the cache will erase your machine settings, Please make sure you have backed up before clearing the cache.

name: CHITUBOX Basic FAQ
title: USB Drive Issues
content: Printers may fail to read certain USB drives sometimes. Usually this is because your printer's control board was designed to work with USB 2.0 with a capacity of 16GB or less. USB 3.0 uses a larger current, which can cause electrical interference with the control board. Your USB drive should meet the following requirements: * FAT32 format * USB 2.0 * â‰¤ 16GB * Allocation unit size = 2048 bytes

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Introduction
content: CHITUBOX Pro is a powerful 3D printing software that slices 3D mesh files into printable files. The program provides a wide variety of functionalities and customizable options to enhance your 3D printing experience greatly improve print quality and minimize risk of print failures. Compared to CHITUBOX Basic, it contains more tools for model preparation such as splitting models, adding labels, Boolean operations, adding custom holes and more.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Main Features
content: Powerful Model Processing Tools: CHITUBOX Pro provides more tools for model preparation such as splitting models, adding labels, Boolean operations, adding custom holes and more. Rich support options: CHITUBOX Pro contains adaptive supports, vertical supports, upright supports, tree supports and other support forms. Multiple Risk Detections: CHITUBOX Pro provides multiple [Risk Detection](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/risk-detection) functions, such as cavity detection, clash detection and overhang detection.Convenient Automated Functions: CHITUBOX Pro provides [ChituAction](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/chitu-action) and [Magic Supports](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/magic-support) which allow you to script and execute the model processing workflow and automate custom support creation. A Massive Material Library: CHITUBOX Pro has built-in Resin Material Alliance enabling direct downloading of resin material property data inside the program. You can also upload your own customized material data to the cloud library.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: System Requirements
content: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/installation#system-requirements.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Required Environments
content: [.NET Framework 4.5](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30653) [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2012](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30679) [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784) [Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2015, 2017 and 2019](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/windows/latest-supported-vc-redist?view=msvc-170)

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Windows
content: Download the installation package from our [official site](https://www.chitubox.com/en/page/chitubox-pro) and double-click the downloaded installer to start the installation process. Click 'Next' to continue. Read the End User License Agreement. Check the 'I accept the license' option if you agree to the terms, and click 'Next' to continue. Choose the installation path. We recommend you using the default path. Click 'Next' to continue. Wait for the installation to complete.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Account and License Key
content: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/account-and-license

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Account Registration
content: Please click [here](https://cc.chitubox.com/register) and sign up if you have not registered a CHITUBOX account.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: License Key
content: An account can have multiple license keys. The license key will be automatically linked to your account when you make a purchase. This license key cannot be unbound from the account. A personal version of license key can be used on up to two computers. A team version of the license key can be used on up to 5 computers. You can log onto user center anytime to unlink your computers. WARNING: Please do not share your license key with anybody and bind it to your account right after you receive it. ATTENTION: CHITUBOX Pro uses online account verification. Please ensure that your computer is connected to the internet.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Activate and Bind License Keys
content: 1.A pop-up window will appear when CHITUBOX Pro starts up for the first time. ATTENTION: A license check shall starts after user login. The Start Program dialog will not appear if the account does not meet the requirements (the account or the computer is already in use) 2.Enter your license key:Clicking on the Confirm Authorization button activates the license key and binds it to your computer. The effective period of the key starts from the day the key is activated. For license keys issued by a printer manufacturer, you may need to enter your printer ID to finish binding. You can log into [your account](https://cc.chitubox.com/login) on the official CHITUBOX website, and go to My Products > My License Key to view your linked license keys.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Unbind License Keys
content: You will need to unbind your license key from your current computer if you want to migrate CHITUBOX to a new machine. Log into your [CHITUBOX account](https://cc.chitubox.com/login) on web. Click on My Products > My License Keys Click on Managed Linked PC > Unlink Your license key will be unbound from your current computer, and then you can re-activate the key on a new machine. You can also perform unbinding in the CHITUBOX software. Entry Main Menu Account > Authorization > Unbind the Current Computer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Replace License Key
content: You will need to manually replace a license key upon expiration. Entry Main Menu Account > Authorization. Replace the license key with a new one, and click on Confirm Authorization to activate the key and bind it to your computer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Quick Start
content: This chapter will guide you through the basic functions of CHITUBOX Pro to get you started. We will begin with introducing model loading, and then adding supports, slicing models and finally exporting printable files to your printer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Machine
content: Upon starting up CHITUBOX Pro for the first time. you will be asked to add your printer. Take ELEGOO Jupiter as an example, single click on the plus icon  on the machine tab or click Add Machine on the [Function Menu](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/user-interface/function-menu), and then choose ELEGOO Jupiter from the printer list. Click 'Next'. You can change the printer configuration here. For convenience purposes, we are using the default settings here. Click 'Apply'. WARNING: Please do not change the Resolution and Size or the built-in printer configuration file, which may lead to errors when printers read the files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Load Files
content: ou can open the file selection dialog or drag existing files directly to the program to load them. Now we will try to open a file with the file selection dialog. Click on the main menu located at the top left corner. Click 'Open Project' to load an existing project. Click 'Open' to load in 3D model files. You can click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#3d-mesh-file) to see supported 3D file formats. Choose a 3D model file that you want to slice from your computer. Open file.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Supports
content: Our model. may not be printed successfully without supports. The model is very unstable with just one contact point with the print platform and its center of weight higher than the contact point. Click the 'Support' tab one the function tabs to go into the support configuration window. We will use 'Magic Support' to automatically add supports in this chapter to stay concise. Click the Magic Support icon on the left side, and then click 'Apply' to automatically add supports to the model. Great! Now we can continue to slicing the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice
content: Click the 'Prepare' tab above the function menu to go back to the main window. And then click the 'Single Parameter Slic' button on the bottom right corner to slice the file. The slicing process can take some time, depending on the size of the model and the level of complexity of the supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Export Printable Files
content: As a last step, click 'Save Slice' on the bottom right corner to open the save slice file window. WARNING: Please do not save the slice file directly to a thumb drive, which may lead to file corruptions. It is recommended to save the slice file to your computer's hard drive first and then copy the file to a USB Drive. Furthermore, we strongly recommend loading a slice file back to CHITUBOX first and previewing the file to check for obvious errors when printing larger models, in order to avoid wasting time and resin on a corrupted file. You can name the file and choose the saving directly for the file here. Please make sure to choose the .ctb format under the 'Save Type' dropdown menu. Click 'Save' to save the file and then copy the file to a USB Drive. Congratulations on finishing the basic tutorials for CHITUBOX and enjoy printing!

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Printer Management
content: This chapter introduces how to add, configure and delete printers in CHITUBOX Pro.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Printers
content: Entry Function Menu,Prepare,Add Machine, Machine Tab, and Click icon to add new printers. Choose your printer's make and model. Click 'Next'. Configure your printer, and click 'Apply' to finish adding a printer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Delete Printers
content: Entry, Machine Tab,Printer Menu > Delete Machine.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Printer Configuration
content: One printer can store multiple slicing configuration profiles. Printer configuration consists of four parts: 'Machine', 'Resin', 'Print' and 'Advanced'. 'Machine' settings are universal and can be applied to all print configurations under the current printer. 'Resin', 'Print' and 'Advanced' settings are independent and can be edited separately for each configuration.Entry, Profile List, Double Click a Configuration File, Slice Panel, and Slice Settings

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Name
content: Machine Name is a custom name for the printer configuration and can use any characters.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Machine Type
content: Machine type is the make and model of your printer. Each machine types corresponds to a set resolution, size and slice format that need to match your printer. The setting cannot be edited.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Mirror
content: Printer's mirror mode for exposing images, including Normal, LCD_mirror and DLP_normal. Machines built into CHITUBOX have been preset with matching Mirror Modes. You can also choose suitable mirror modes based on your own case. NOTE:Screen installations issues on some printers may lead to image mirroring. We suggest that you observe the exposure patten with UV protections glasses before printing. For pull-up LCD printers, printed models are normal (not mirrored) when the exposure pattern is mirrored. You will need to try other options when the exposure image is not mirrored.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Resolution and Size
content: Resolution stands for the printer's resolution in x, y and z direction with pixel as units. Size stands for the size of the printable area with mm as units.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Build Area Offset
content: Build Area Offset is designed for the case when there are bad points in the edge area of your printer's curing screen, or when parts of the edge are non-working areas. Build Area Offset is used to avoid those areas.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Resin
content: Resin Type and Resin Name can be customized for differentiation. After inputting Resin Density and Resin Price, CHITUBOX can estimate print cost based on the slice volume.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Print
content: Set print parameters here.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Parameter Description
content: NOTE: Only some printers support Resting Time waiting mode. Read the [full compatible list](https://wkhvloo2kw.feishu.cn/docx/Q5nbdGSnfo5EbAxgEwKccN0Rnxe) here. The detailed information of Parameters and their Description are as follow. Layer Height: Thickness of each layer printed. Bottom Layer Count: Number of layers at the beginning of the print. The Bottom Exposure Time applies to the first number of layers set by this parameter. Exposure Time: Exposure time of normal print layers. Bottom Exposure Time:Set the exposure time of the bottom layers. increasing the exposure time of the bottom layers helps increase the bond strength between the printing model and the printing platform. Transition Layer Count: The number of transition layers between the print bottom layers and the normal print layers. when printing in transition layers, the exposure time will decrease with the increase of printing layers. Other printing settings in the transition layers are the same as normal layers. Transition Type: Set the transition type of the exposure time for the transition layers. Waiting Mode During Printing: Resting Time: Rest Time Before Lift: A time interval between light-off and the build plate starts to lift. Rest Time After Lift: A time interval between the build plate lifts to the Lifting Distance and starts to retract. Rest Time After Retract: A time interval between the build plate retracts to the lowest point and light-on. Light off Delay: Light-off delay is the total time of build plate lifts up, wait, and retract. Light-off delay is the total time of build plate lifts up, wait, and retract. Light-off Delay: Light-off delay for normal layers, Actual machine light-off time = maximum (total time of Z-axis up and down movement, configured light-off delay). Bottom Light-off Delay: Light-off delay for bottom layers, Actual machine light-off time = maximum (total time of Z-axis up and down movement, configured light-off delay). Bottom Lift Distance: The distance of the printing platform moves away from the printing surface each time during bottom layers printing process. Lifting Distance: The distance of the printing platform moves away from the printing surface each time during normal layers printing process. Bottom Retract Distance: The distance of retract, leave it alone unless you have sufficient reason during bottom layers printing process. Retract Distance:The distance of retract, leave it alone unless you have sufficient reason during normal layers printing process. Bottom Lift Speed: The speed of the printing platform moves away from the printing surface each time during bottom layers printing process. Lifting Speed: The speed of the printing platform moves away from the printing surface each time during normal layers printing process. Bottom Retract Speed: The speed of the printing platform moves to the printing surface each time during bottom layers printing process. Retract Speed: The speed of the printing platform moves to the printing surface each time during normal layers printing process.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Two-Stage Motion Control (TSMC)
content: Note for Anycubic Users: Please note if you come from Anycubic Photon Workshop: Anycubic Photon Workshop has basic settings and advanced settings, which are not differentiated in CHITUBOX formats. CHITUBOX only displays basic settings for printers not compatible with advanced settings. And only advanced settings are displayed for printers supporting both. You can also enter the same speed for the two stages and make sure that the total lift distance meets requirements if you do not want to use TSMC on a printer supporting advanced settings. The order in which TSMC parameters are displayed in the UI is different for Anycubic Photon Workshop, where [0] indicates the motion stage close to the screen and [1] indicates the motion stage further from the screen. However, the parameters are displayed following the motion pattern in CHITUBOX, which might be confusing at first. There are two groups of lift and retract parameters in print settings for setting up TSMC. As the print platform lifts up with the model, the FEP film at the bottom of the resin vat pulls on the layer that is just cured until the layer detaches from the film. The suction effect is stronger when the model has larger contact areas with the FEP film and when the platform lifts up at higher speeds. The suction effect may cause the model to deform or even pull the model down from the print platform. We suggest that you should keep the lift process slow until the model detaches from the film. The lift can be accelerated when suction effect is no longer a concern to improve print efficiency. And the retract process follows the same principle.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Light PWM
content: PWM is abbreviation for Pulse Width Modulation. The principle is to control the light intensity of the light source by adjusting the duty cycle of the light source per unit time. Light PWM and Bottom Light PWM control printers' light intensity for normal layers and bottom layers respectively. You can adjust the parameters based on your own cases.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Picture Grayscale
content: Picture Gray Scale controls the grayscale of the exposed area of the slice image (without supports) and ranges from 0 to 255, with larger values closer to white and smaller values closer to black. For LCD printers, the whiter the exposed area of the slice image, the higher the light transmission. For DLP printers, the whiter the slice image exposure area, the higher the light intensity.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Anti-aliasing
content: Anti-aliasing has two modes: Gray Scale Level and Anti-aliasing Level.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Gray Scale Level
content: Gray Scale Level reduces triangular sawtooth by grayscale feathering the edges of the sliced image for LCD printers.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Anti-aliasing Level
content: Anti-aliasing Level is a customizable interval values from 0 to 255, which limits the range of grayscale values that can be used when blurring the image to feather the edges of the exposure range.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Image Blurring
content: Image Blurring range from 2 to 8. The higher level you select, the softer the edges are.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Anti-aliasing Level (legacy)
content: Anti-aliasing Level reduces the sawtooth on image edges by running several quick exposures and only can be applied to early printers supporting the .cbddlp formats.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Shrinkage Compensation
content: Shrinkage Compensation is in principle no different from scaling a model. It works on the current configuration rather than a particular model, avoiding the need to manually modify the model size when switching between different printers or configurations. Shrinkage Compensate uses a percentage to scale from the original size with the default at 100%ã€‚The model body is larger with a larger percentage value. The model body is smaller with a smaller percentage value.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Tolerance Compensation
content: Tolerance Compensation and Bottom Tolerance Compensation control compensation for printers' normal layers and bottom layers respectively, typically used to resolve the fit of workpieces such as bolts and nuts, mortise and tenon construction. Bottom Tolerance Compensation is usually used to resolve the 'elephant trunk' effect due to long exposure time. Tolerance compensation works by labeling the inner diameter (a) and outer diameter (b) of each layer of the exposed image, and then adjusting the size of the inner and outer diameters according to the tolerance compensation values. When a is larger, the inner diameter is shorter. When a is smaller, the inner diameter is longer. When b is larger, the outer diameter is longer. When b is smaller, the outer diameter is shorter. NOTE: When the bottom layer tolerance compensation is disabled, the normal layer tolerance compensation will be effective for the whole model. Tolerance compensation works by check the inner diameter (a) and outer diameter (b) of each layer, not by scaling 3D models directly. As a result your models should not have sudden changes in inner and outer diameters (i.e. inner diameter changes to outer diameter or vice versa at a certain height). For example, such changes to a slice file may happen for a vertical tube with an horizontal hole at a certain height. Bottom tolerance compensates only affects bottom layers. When transition layer compensation and bottom tolerance compensation are both enabled, the print result may be not be as good as expected.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Print Time Compensation
content: Some high-resolution printers can have extra delays when loading data and will lead to inaccurate printing time estimation. You can set up a time compensation to improve the issue. Manual Input: Layer Print Time Compensation: a 2-digit number between -99.99 and 99.99 with default set at 0 s. When enabled, the Estimated Time For A Single Layer = Exposure Time + Waiting Time + Movement Time + Layer Print Time Compensation. Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/printer-management/printer-configuration#print-time-compensation) to learn more about Auto Generation Time

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Mask
content: Mask is designed to solve a common light source issue of uneven light strength at different spots of the screen. The issue is usually caused by improper light sources. The purpose of the mask is to provide a correction layer on the screen by adjusting the transmittance on different areas of the screen respectively, making the uneven light homogeneous. Mask File: You can select an existing image by clicking the ... icon, or click the gear icon to create a new one using CHITUBOX's built-in [mask generator](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/printer-management/printer-configuration#mask-generator). Gray Scale Unit: click [here](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/printer-management/printer-configuration#gray-scale-unit) to learn more about gray scale unit.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Mask Generator
content: Mask Generator in CHITUBOX supports two modes: Hub-and-Spoke and Matrix Mode.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Hub-and-Spoke
content: Hub-and-Spoke generate a ripple-like pattern. The number of circles is set by Number of equal parts. Radius of circles are arithmetic sequence with a delta set by Equal radius. The range of Gray Parameter is between 0 (black) to 255 (white)ã€‚For example, if Number of equal parts is set to 5, Equal radius is set to 3mm, the radius of the ripple will be 5Ã—3=15 mm. Here is a comparison for different Equal radius: https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/printer-management/printer-configuration#hub-and-spoke

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Matrix Mode
content: Matrix Mode generates a matrix-like pattern. Rows and columns are set by m and n respectively. The range of Gray Parameter is from 0 (black) to 255 (white). For example, here is a 2 Ã— 3 matrix with different grayscales.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Gray scale unit
content: Gray scale unit is used to average the gray value of specified number of pixels in X-axis direction, and apply averaged grayscale to pixels in corresponding position of the original image. Example: Let's say the size of the build plate is multiplying 80mm by 120mm, the resolution of the screen is multiplying 800px by 1200px. This is the mask picture, also with resolution of multiplying 800px by 1200px. All squares in the picture have the size of multiplying 50px by 50px: https://manual.chitubox.com/images/docs/zh-CN/chitubox-pro/1.x.x/004-setting-up-configure-printer-parameters004.3.png. If the Gray scale unit was set to 51px, the processed image will be like this: https://manual.chitubox.com/images/docs/zh-CN/chitubox-pro/1.x.x/004-setting-up-configure-printer-parameters004.4.png. The grayscale increases from left to right as a result of averaging out every 51 pixels. Take the first row as an example: The first 51 pixels include 50 black pixels and 1 white pixel. The resulting average value is a tint lighter than pure black, barely noticeable to the naked eyes. The second group of 51 pixels contains 49 white pixels and 2 black pixels, averaging out to a color slightly darker than white. The third group of 51 pixels will be masked to the average grayscale of 48 dark pixels and 3 white pixels and so on, until we reach the remaining 35 odd pixels. Dividing 800 by 51 equals to 15, remainder 35. This remaining pixels' gray scale will be the average of 35 pixels of the same shade. Therefore, the resulting grayscale doesn't change.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Project File
content: File Type is CHITUBOX Project File 2023, File Suffix is *.ctp and the Description is that Including more model data (location, angle, and supports larger file sizes). File Type is CHITUBOX Project File, File Suffix is *.chitubox and the Description is that Legacy file format; includes basic model data and support data.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: New Project

name: CHITUBOX Pro
