name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Save Project
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#save-project) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Supported 3D Mesh File Format
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#supported-3d-mesh-file-format) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Import 3D Mesh File
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#import-3d-mesh-file) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Export 3D Mesh File
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#export-3d-mesh-file) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Open Recent Files
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#open-recent-files) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Supported Slice File Formats
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#supported-slice-file-formats) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Import and Export Slice Files
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#import-and-export-slice-files) to learn more details. TIP: Besides importing files as described above, you can drag model files, project files or slice files directly to the program window to quickly open the files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice File Thumbnail View
content: You can change the slice file thumbnail in settings. Three types of thumbnails are supported: Placement View, Home View and Front View.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Configuration File
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#configuration-file) to learn more details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Model File
content: Automatically adds suffix to the model file name based on your presets. i.e.'#number', 'Hollowed', 'Repaired' or 'Mirrored'.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Project File
content: Append Model Filename Sequentially: generate the filename based on the order in which the models are loaded into the file.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice File
content: Configure naming rules for slice files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Duplicate Name Replacement
content: Set the rules for conflicting file names.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Character Replacement
content: Certain operating systems do not allow special characters in file names. These characters will be automatically replaced based on preset rules.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Custom Character Replacement
content: Allows you to customize character replacement rules.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Model Processing
content: This chapter introduces model processing functions of CHITUBOX Pro, including selection, moving, rotating, scaling, mirroring, copying, splitting models, automatic layout, adding labels, Boolean operations, cutting, hollowing and hole creation. Click on the 'Prepare' tab at the top of the function menu to open the prepare menu.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Select
content: Click to select the model in the canvas. Drag and select all models within the selection box.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Move
content: Moves selected models. You can also enter coordinates in the move panel to accurately move models.Center: Place selected model at the center of the print platform. Multiple model within selection will be centered based on the center of the model group. On Platform: Place selected model on the print platform based on the lowest point of the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Rotate
content: Rotates selected models. You can also enter degree angles in the rotate panel to accurately rotate models. Combination Center: Set the center of rotation at the combination center of multiple selected models. Orient to Face: Place selected models on the platform by aligning a model surface to the platform. Auto Orientation: Rotate selected models to the optimal position.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Scale
content: Scales selected models. You can also input the exact size or scale ratio to accurately scale models.Global Coordinates: Align the scale controller to the global coordinates. Local Coordinates: Align the scale controller to the model's local coordinates. Reset: Reset the model scale to 100% of the original size. Lock Ratio: when enabled, selected models will be scaled at the same ratio in the X,Y and Z directions, in order to keep the overall ratio of the model and avoid deformation. Scale to Fit: automatically adjust the size of selected models to fit on the print platform.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Mirror
content: Mirrors selected models based on a selected axis. Keep the Original Model: when enabled, both of the original model and the mirrored model will be kept.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Copy
content: Copies one or multiple selected models, and add specified number of copied models to the current project.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Split Model
content: Splits the original assembly model into independent part models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Auto Layout
content: Quickly layouts the models in the project according to the set arrangement rule, including auto-layout at the center of the print platform, and arrange along the X-edge or Y-edge of the platform. Allow Raft Overlapping: allow rafts of models to overlap during auto layout. Lock Model Rotation (Z): lock the rotation angle of models to keep a fixed orientation during rotation. Loop Layout: automatically arrange models in a loop. Layout Scope: set the scope for the auto layout operation.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Tag
content: Adds custom text tag to models. You can control the text style and alignment in the panel. Click on the text box to input tag text. Height(mm): the text height for the tag with default at 5mm. Angle: the angle at which the text is rotated clockwise. Depth(mm): thickness/depth of the tag.Mode: choose between extrusion tag or engraving tag.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Boolean Operation
content: Executes Join, Intersect or Subtraction operations between selected models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Hollow
content: Entry Function: Menu Prepare > Hollow Shortcu Shift adds H.ollows selected models based on custom parameters. Wall Thickness: the remaining wall thickness for the hollowed object(the shaved off thickness under Outer Hollow mode). Precision: the density of triangles generated for the hollowing surfaces. 0 represents the minimum precision and 1 is the maximum precision. Mode:Inner Hollow: leaves an enclosed cavity after hollowing. Outer Hollow: shave off material from the outer surface based on Wall Thickness. Bottom Through: similar effect to Inner Hollow without keeping the bottom of the object. Infill: generate preset infill structure during the hollowing operation. Animation: displays animation showing the hollowing process(refer to the progress bar for the actual process). Keep the Main Cavity: generates one single cavity during the hollowing operation.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Scaffold
content: Infill cavities with scaffold structures. Infill Density (%): the density of the infill structure.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Hive
content: Infill cavities with hive structures. The hive structures shall be perpendicular to the platform. Hexagon Diameter(mm): the diameter of each hive hexagon's circumscribed circle. Wall Thickness(mm): the distance between each adjacent hexagons. Crossing Hole Starting Height(mm): the minimum height of holes cross the hexagon structures.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Grid
content: Infill cavities with grid structures. The grid structures shall be perpendicular to the platform. Grid Width(mm): the width of each square grid. Wall Thickness(mm): the distance between each adjacent grids. Crossing Hole Starting Height(mm): the minimum height of holes cross the grid structures. NOTE: Round crossing holes are automatically generated between adjacent holes in order to relieve pressure during printing for hive and grid structures. The diameter of the crossing holes is 1/6 of the hexagons' circumscribed diameter or grid width. The starting height of the crossing holes is based on the centerline of the holes and user-set height. Additional groups of crossing holes are generated with equal spacing of The center of the hexagons' circumscribed diameter or grid width.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Hole
content: Create holes on selected models based on custom parameters. Hole Mode: Choose between generating Penetrating or Non-penetrating holes. Edge Number: As number of edge increases, the shape of the hole will get close to a circle. Î¦: The diameter of the hole. B: The maximum depth of the hole for non-penetrating holes. C: The angle between the side wall of the hole and the bottom plane of the hole. Rotation: The rotation angle of the hole. Retain Plug: Whether to keep the excavated material as a separate part. Angle: Digging angle perpendicular to the screen or to the model. Limited Depth B: Turning On/Off limiting hole depth as defined by B under Penetrating mode.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Display Size
content: Entry: Function Menu, Analyze/Measure > Display Size Component List. Automatically measures and displays the size of the model's [enclosure](https://computersciencewiki.org/index.php/Bounding_boxes).

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Two Point Distance
content: Measures and displays the distance between two points on the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Point to Plane Distance
content: Measures and displays the distance between a point and a plane on the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Parallel Plane Distance
content: Measures and displays the distance between two parallel planes on the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support
content: Deep dive into the support functions in CHITUBOX Pro to create reliable supports for your models. Entry:Function Menu, Support. Click the Support tab on the function menu to go into the support window.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Auto Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#auto-support) to learn about Auto Support.Automatically generates support structures based on support parameters and models' geometric features to save users' time and effort.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Manual Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#manual-support) to learn about Manual Support. You can manually add supports based on your own experience and understanding of models to achieve best printing results.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Adaptive Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#adaptive-support) to learn about adaptive supports. Adaptive supports would generate suitable support intelligently to match model features.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Vertical Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#vertical-support) to learn about vertical supports. Place supports with contacting segments perpendicular to model surfaces.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Upright Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#upright-support) to learn about upright supports. Place supports that are perpendicular to the print platform.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Branch Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#upright-support) to learn about branch supports. Branch Supports are single-segment supports, usually used to connect model surface with the mid-segment of another support or connect two supports, in order to further stabilize a model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Joint Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#joint-support) to learn about joint supports.Joint Supports consists of two support segments. Similar to branch supports, they can be connected to models or other supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Small Pillar
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#small-pillar) to learn about small pillar.This is a type of thin support connecting the model and another support's middle segment or connecting two points on the surfaces of a model. Smaller pillars are ideal of models with small overhangs and many details by providing fine supports to small areas. TIP: Users can enable the Automatic Attachment option when using Branch, Joint and Small Pillar supports and customize the parameters Attachment Radius and Attachment Angle in the More Support Settings panel under the 'Advanced Settings' window.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Forked Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#forked-support) to learn about forked support. Branch Supports connect with models on top and branch off to connect to the mid-segments of adjacent supports to form stable support grids.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Tree Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#tree-support) to learn about tree support. Tree Supports has several branching supports from the main pilar, similar to tree branch structures. Tree Supports can provide even support forces to effectively prevent model deformation.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Contour Supporte
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#contour-support) to learn about contour support. Add supports at a given height on a model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Face Supporte
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#contour-support) to learn about face support. Add supports to a selected face on a model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Boundary Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#boundary-support) to learn about boundary support. Add supports to the boundary of a selected face on a model, to avoid overhang warping or breaking during printing.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Symmetrical Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#symmetrical-support) to learn about symmetrical support. Detect symmetrical surfaces on a model and add mirrored supports to both sides of selected symmetrical planes.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Merge Supports
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#merge-supports) to learn about merge support. Automatically merge some or all supports to simplify support structures and lower print cost.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Supports to Overhangs
content: Manually or automatically add supports to overhang areas after running [Overhang Detection](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/risk-detection#overhang-detection) can prevent overhangs from deforming or breaking during printing.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Edit Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#edit-support) to learn about edit support. Modify added supports, including adjusting support size, density and locations to optimize print results.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Delete Support
content: Click this [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#delete-support) to learn about edit support.Remove unnecessary support structures to save material.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Model Lift Height
content: The height distance between the lowest point on the model and the print platform.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Plate
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#plate) to learn about parameters of the plate.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Cross Grid
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#cross-gride) to learn about parameters of the cross grid.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Hexagonal Grid
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#hexagonal-grid) to learn about parameters of the hexagonal grid.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Linear Connection
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#linear-connection) to learn about parameters of the Linear Connection.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Profile
content: You can Add, Import, Export, and Save support profiles here. Click the icon to directly open the settings dialog and navigate to '[Enhance Auto Support](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#enhanced-automatic-support)'. Hovering over the icon following each profile brings up available actions, including Rename, Export, Reset, and Delete.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Top Segment Upper Diameter
content: Diameter at the upper end of the support's top segment.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Angle
content: Maximum allowable angle between the model surface (tangential plane) and the platform for auto support generation.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Contact Point Spacing
content: Spacing between each support tip contacting the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Main Pillar Spacing
content: The minimum horizontal distance between any two supports' mid segments. TIP: Contact Point Spacing and Main Pillar Spacing are two important parameters affecting support density. The smaller the values are, the denser the supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Advanced Settingse
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#advanced-settings) to learn about advanced settings.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Top
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#top) to learn more about Top supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Middle
content: Smaller Pillar: Small Pillar is a type of support structure used to support small spaces, with both ends connecting to model surfaces. Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#top) to learn more about Middle supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Bottom
content: Support Bottom includes settings for segments rested on the print platform and settings when the bottom segment rests on the model surface. Bottom segment on model surfaces. NOTE: Below options applies to bottom segments rested on model surfaces, in other words, when both ends of a supports contact model surfaces. These settings are no applicable during 'Edit' model. Switch to 'Add' model to edit the settings.Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#bottom) to learn more about bottom supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Raft
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#raft) to learn more about the raft.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: More Support Settings
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/support-configuration#more-support-settings) to learn more about More Support Settings.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Enhanced Automatic Support
content: Auxillary supports with cross bracings will be added automatically to certain isolated supporting columns during Auto Support. Triangular Reinforcement (TR): The program will try to automatically connect adjacent support columns to form stable triangular structures with Trianglular Reinforcement during Auto Support. Global Reinforcement (GR): The program will try to inter-connect all adjacent support columns to form a more stable structure composed of small triangular structures under Global Reinforcement during Auto Support.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Auto Support Mode
content: There are three modes for auto support: +All, +Platform and +Overhang. +All allows support generation on model surface, +Platform allows support generation on the platform, and +Overhang generates support on all overhangs.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Auto Support Type
content: Auto Support type includes: Branch, Joint, Adaptive, Vertical, Upright and Small Pillar. Choose applicable options from the support types, click the 'Auto Add Support' button to generate corresponding support types.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Magic Support
content: Magic Support is an intelligent support generation algorithm that can execute several support creation commands with just one click. You can press one button to achieve a series of support actions. Click Apply to create supports based on the order of support settings from top to bottom.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Manage Magic Support Profiles
content: In the Profile Panel you can add new profiles, download profiles, import profiles, export all Magic Support profiles. By hovering icon, you can see the available operations for the configuration, including upload, rename, export, reset, delete.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add/Delete a Step
content: Add a step: click the + sign at the bottom of a step card to add a new auto support step below. Delete a step: click the - sign at the right side of a step to delete an unnecessary step.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Step Settings
content: Click the [link](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/magic-support#step-settings) to learn more parameters of Step settings.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Merge Supports
content: When enabled, added supports will be automatically merged at the end.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Cavity Detection
content: The cavity detection button is located on the right side of the machine tabs. Cavity Detection can help users identify any enclosed cavities within 3D models, such as closed pockets or holes. Users can add holes to models to avoid vacuum effects during printing. Shown below is a hollowed model, with cavity detection turned off and on.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Collision Detection
content: The collision detection button is located on the right side of the machine tabs.Collision detection can help users highlight collisions among 3D models. Users can adjust models to avoid such collisions.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Overhang Detection
content: Suspension Detection can be used in the support window. Click the 'Support' tab to go to the support window. The overhang detection button is located on the function menu. Three detection accuracy levels are provided: low, medium and high. Higher accuracy renders more precise results but would take longer to finish. Click on to refresh detection results. Cycle through and zoom into the detected areas by clicking on the arrows inside the 'Overhang Area' Panel. Click on the button to automatically add supports to detected overhang areas.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Island Detection
content: Island Detection is similar to Overhang Detection. but it looks for island by iterate through 2D layers instead of 3D shapes. Users will need to slice the model first by clicking on the Single Parameter Slice button in order to use Island Detection. You will see the slice preview window after slicing is complete. The Island Detection and Delete All Islands buttons are located on the top of the preview window.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Check Islands
content: Island Detection looks for all islands in the model. A list of information of detected islands will be displayed in the island detection panel. Island information includes the layer count and coordinates of the island. Clicking on the coordinates of an island would highlight the detected island in the preview window. TIP: You can switch between viewing the island in Local Mode or Overall View by clicking on the coordinates of the island in the island detection panel.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Delete Islands
content: The Detele All Islands button in the island detection panel will tell the program to ignore all detected islands. Usually you would not use the function upon island detection, but go back to add supports to detected islands. You can delete island on certain layers by selecting the island in the island detection panel and click on the Delete button. Click on the [button](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/risk-detection#delete-islands)to refresh detection results.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice
content: Learn about slice techniques in CHITUBOX Pro: set parameters, choose different modes and preview the slice results.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Single Parameter/Multi-parameter Slice
content: Slice is the final step before exporting a printable file. Click the Slice Mode button at the bottom, choose Single Parameter Slice or Multi-parameter Slice, and then click the slice button to enter slicing preview.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Single Parameter Slice
content: Single Parameter Slice uses the configuration file selected from the Configuration List to slice all models on the print platform.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Multi-parameter Slice
content: Multi-parameter Slice is an advanced slicing option, allowing you to set different print parameters for different models, heights or different cross-sectional areas, to achieve more accurate control and higher print qualities. NOTEï¼š Currently only CTB files support multi-parameter slice.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Model
content: Different model object uses different print parameters. Models without specified profiles will be sliced according to the profile set by the Default Configuration File. Changes to profiles with the same name in the same printer environment will be synchronized. When editing differential parameters, Items cannot be edited (marked by *) and other non-displayed printing parameters will follow the default profile.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Height
content: Layers at different heights use different printing parameters. Height sections without specified Profiles comply with the Profile use the Default Profile. Parameters for bottom layers and transition layers follow the Default Profile. When editing differential parameters, Items cannot be edited (marked by *) and other non-displayed printing parameters will follow the default profile.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Cross-sectional Area
content: Different cross-sectional areas use different parameters. The percentage refers to the the cross-section relative to the total effective area of the platform. Sections without specified Profile use the Default Profile. Parameters for bottom layers and transition layers follow the Default Profile. When editing differential parameters, Items cannot be edited (marked by *) and other non-displayed printing parameters will follow the default profile. In the Cross-sectional Area mode, intervals are determined by the cross section areas. So a profile may be used by several intervals, as shown below: Bottom Layers and Transition Layers only apply to the lowest sections.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice Preview
content: The main window will be split into model view and slice preview when the slice process is done. Model View displays sliced models, and Slice Preview shows a preview of every sliced layer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Basic Information Preview
content: You can check basic print information on the top right estimation panel. Print information includes machine model, resin, volume, weight, cost, and estimated print time. NOTE: The volume of resin is a simple calculation of summing up of all voxels (area of pixels x layer height). This is, however, a theoretic value, that can be affected by many other factors in reality, such as residual resin on the build plate or the model, resin volatility, density change during curing etc.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Print Parameter Preview
content: Print Parameter Preview Panel: displays the preview of the slice file, detailed information of the current printer and certain print parameters for the viewed layer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice Parameter Editor
content: Edit and adjust printer parameters of the sliced models. This window provides quick access to some parameters found under Slice Settings > Print, allowing users to change these parameters without quitting the slice preview window. NOTE: Slicing Parameter Editing is only available under Single Parameter Slice mode.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Detect Islands
content: Use [Island Detection](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/risk-detection#island-detection) tools to check for unprintable islands. NOTE: Run Detect Islands first to use the functions [Delete All Islands](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/risk-detection#delete-islands) and [Edit Pixels](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/slice/slice-preview#edit-pixels) .

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Edit Pixels
content: adds or deletes pixels in the current slice file.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Pixels
content: Left click in the slice preview window to add pixels. Hold Ctrl and drag Left-button of the mouse to add continuous pixels.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Delete Pixels
content: Right click in the slice preview window to delete pixels. Hold Ctrl and drag Right-button of the mouse to erase pixels continuously. NOTE: Hold Ctrl and scroll the Middle-button of the mouse to resize the pen

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Save Slice
content: Click the Save Slice button to save the slice file. NOTE: Only file formats supported by the current printer are displayed in the save file dialog. Please go back and check if the right printer is selected if no appropriate file format is available. The Default printer allows you to save the slice file to any format supported by CHITUBOX. You should choose the Default printer type when no configuration file for your printer is loaded into CHITUBOX.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Network Sending
content: The Network Sending button is only available when your printer supports the function. Network Sending allows direct sending of print data to the machine for quick printing. Click on the button to open the [Network Sending Window](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitu-manager/latest/ui-and-features/network-sending). NOTE: Installation of ChituManager is required for Network Sending. Please follow the suggested steps after clicking on the Network Sending button to download and install ChituManager if it has not been installed.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: ChituActione
content: ChituAction is an automated tool integrating model preparation, support creation, auto-layout and model slicing. Click on the icon  after loading models into the program to bring up the ChituAction sequence list. Click on the â€˜Applyâ€™ button after configuring all necessary parameters and choosing paths for file saving. A slicing file and a project file can then be automatically generated with just one click. You can also click on one of the actions within the sequence to execute a single command.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Scale
content: When enabled, ChituAction automatically scales all models based on the preset ratio.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Orient
content: When enabled, ChituAction automatically orients all models based on the preset orientation pattern. Orientation Pattern: Fixed Angle: Manually set the angle of orientation to rotate all models to the same angle. Auto Orientation: Rotates all models to the orientation optimized for printing as calculated by CHITUBOX.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support
content: Add Magic Supports to all models based on your Magic Support settings.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Layout
content: When printing multiple models, you can optimize the models' layout with this option to best utilize the print platform area and minimize manual model movements.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Export/Save
content: Allows direct creation and saving of model files, project files and slice files upon finishing all other actions. Export Model: Supported file formats include .stl, .obj, and .3mf. Save Project: Supported file formats include .ctp, and .chitubox. Save Slice: The default slice file format is the default format for the chosen printer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Standard Parts
content: The Standard Parts library contains a variety of model parts for your direct download and use. 5 types of standard models are provided: Basic Geometry, Testing and Verification, Auxiliary Tools, Mechanical Parts and 3D Mathematical. Hover over any model preview image, click use to download the model.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: User Interface
content: This chapter provides an overview to the user interface of CHITUBOX Pro.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Main Menu
content: Click the Menu button on the top left corner to open the main menu.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: New Project
content: Create a new project.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Open Project
content: Open an existing project file or load a project file and combine with the current project. Project files have an file extension .chitubox . Please make sure not to mix them with 3D model files or slice files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Save Project
content: Save all or selected models to a .chitubox project file.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Open
content: Open project file, load in 3D model file or slice files. WARNING: Please note that .ctb files are the final slice file that can only be used for printing in most cases. Please do not perform 3D model manipulations on these files. Slice files only support some non-modeling operations such as exposure time, platform move speed and pixel editing(only in CHITUBOX Pro).

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Export Model
content: Export all or selected models (including supports). You can export models in any of the supported formats, allowing you to share models with other users or use them with other 3D modeling software.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Recently Opened
content: Open projects files and 3D model files that have been successfully opened in the software.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Account
content: Open Personal Center and manage your authorization.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Community
content: Visit the official CHITUBOX community, where you can interact with other users using our software, access latest news, new versions and updates. Welcome to join the community and create endless possibility with CHITUBOX!

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Feedback
content: You can submit any ideas, suggestions and feedback about CHITUBOX to our development team.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Language
content: Users can select the displayed language based on their needs. Currently supported languages includes: German, English, French, Italian, Hungarian, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese, Finnish, Turkish, Spanish, Czech, Greek, Russian, Arabic, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese and Korean.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Check for Updates
content: Check if the current software version needs updates and display update logs for different versions.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Update Log
content: Display software update log information.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Factory Settings
content: Restore factory settings. This helps you to resolve any software issues or reset the program.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Export Configuration
content: Export current machine settings to a .cfgx file. This function helps to backup print configurations or share your configuration with other users.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Import Configuration
content: Choose a .cfg or .cfgx file and import to the current machine settings. This function helps to restore print settings or use print settings shared by other users.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: About CHITUBOX
content: Check software information, including current version number, copy right information and more. This window helps you to know version of the currently running software and ensure it is up to date.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Quality Improvement
content: Participate in the quality improvement plan. Check and see what data CHITUBOX is collecting and how the data is used.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Open Log Path
content: Visit the folder containing log files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: User Manual
content: Read CHITUBOX user manual.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Plugins
content: Manage software plugins. You can import or export plugins to support printers that do not use Chitu Systems.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Correct Translation
content: Correct translation errors.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Shortcut
content: Check and manage shortcuts

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Settings
content: General settings for CHITUBOX Pro.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Theme
content: There are three themes available: Light, Dark and Classic.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: UI Display Scale
content: Change the size of displayed UI.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Model Projection
content: Turn on/off the display of model shadow projected onto the platform.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice File Thumbnail
content: Change the displayed view used for slice file thumbnails.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Default View
content: Default displayed view when starting up CHITUBOX.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Default Save Directory
content: Choose the default directory when saving files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Use same directory for saving and opening
content: When enabled, the saving directory will always be the same as the latest directory for opening files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Model Naming
content: Automatically add suffixes to file names based on your choice, such as '#number', 'hollowed', 'repaired' and 'mirrored'.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Project File Rename
content: Combine Model Names: generate project file name by appending model file names based on the order of models loaded into the file.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice File Naming
content: Set rules for naming slice files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Duplicate Name Replacement
content: Set the naming rule for conflicting file names.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Character Replacement
content: Some operating systems do not allow certain characters in filenames. Built-in characters will be used to automatically replace those characters with other characters.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Custom Character Replacement
content: Define custom character replacement rules.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Max Undo
content: This allows you to change the maximum number of undo operations that can be performed.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Desktop Thumbnail Preview
content: Enable/disable Desktop Thumbnail Preview

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Preview (for manual supports)
content: Enable/disable support preview during manual supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Auxiliary Line
content: Enable/disable support auxiliary line.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Graphic Tooltip
content: Enable/disable graphic tooltips.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Print Estimation Panel
content: Enable/disable print estimation panel at the bottom left corner.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Allow Raft Overlap in Collision Detection
content: When enabled, collision detection ignores support raft overlaps and will not generate warnings for them.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Hidden Angle
content: The angle between the view camera's axis and negative z axis of the print platform. Supports will be hidden when the angle is smaller than the set value.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Network Transmission Integrity Check
content: Enable/disable check for slice file integrity when sending files through network. When enabled, users will receive a notification when the file is incomplete.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Prompt for Model Generation when Loading Slice Files
content: Enable/disable prompt asking whether to reverse-generate model when loading in slice files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Examples
content: Open example models come with the software.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Exit Software
content: Exit CHITUBOX Pro.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: General Options
content: New Project: create a new project file. Display Mode: supports Solid, X-Ray, Triangle Mesh and Wire Frame modes.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Options for Right-click on Models
content: Save: save the current project file. Delete Model: delete currently selected models. Replace Model: the option allows you to replace a supported model with a slightly different model without re-supporting it. Select Model: allows you to select a model when the pointer is on an unselected model. You can also hold down the Ctrl key and click to select multiple models. Deselect Model: allows you to deselect a model when the pointer is on an selected model. Reverse Select: deselect currently selected models and select all unselected models. Paste: copy and paste current model. Move: open the Move tool panel. Input value to accurately move selected models or drag models to disired locations. Rotate: open the Rotate tool panel and enable free rotation of selected models. Scale: open the Scale tool panel to adjust model size. Mirror: open the Mirror tool panel to choose mirror options for selected models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Options for Right-click on Black Spaces in the Canvas
content: Select All: select all models. Deselect All: deselect all models. Delete All: delete all models. Front View: switch to front view to observe models. Back View: switch to back view to observe models. Left View: switch to left view to observe models. Right View: switch to right view to observe models. Top View: switch to top view to observe models. Bottom View: switch to bottom view to observe models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Prepare Function Tab
content: Click 'Prepare' on the Function Menu to switch to the Prepare function tab.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Machine
content: [Add a new machine](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/printer-management/add-and-delete-printers#add-printers)

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: History
content: [Visit Recently Opened Files](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#open-recent-files)

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Open
content: Open project files, import 3D models and slice files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Export
content: Export all models, export selected models in combination or separately (including supports). Files can be exported as project files(.chitubox/.ctp) or model files.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Save
content: [Save the current project file.](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/file#save-project)

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Copy
content: [Copy](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#copy) one or multiple selected models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Split Model
content: [Split an originally assembled model](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#split-model) into individual parts.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Auto Layout
content: [Quickly arrange and layout multiple models](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#auto-layout) based on selected options.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Add Tag
content: [Add preset tags](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#add-tag) to models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Boolean Operation
content: Carry out [Boolean Operations](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#boolean-operation) such as Join, Intersect or Subtraction for multiple selected models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Hollow
content: [Hollow out](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#hollow) selected models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Function Tab
content: Click 'Support' on the Function Menu to switch to the Support function tab

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Symmetrical Support
content: Add [Symmetrical Supports](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#symmetrical-support) to models.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Merge Supports
content: [Automatically merge some or all supports.](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/add-edit-delete#merge-supports)

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Overhang Detection
content: [Detect Overhang areas](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/risk-detection#overhang-detection) and add supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Analyze/Measure Function Tab
content: Click 'Analyze/Measure' on the Function Menu to switch to the Analyze/Measure function tab.Click [here](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/analyze-and-measure) to learn more.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Toolbar
content: Toolbar is located on the left side of the main window. The tools displayed on the toolbar change depending on the current workspace.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Prepare, Analyze/Measure Interface
content: The toolbar in the Prepare and Analyze/Measure interface contains six tools: [ChituAction](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/chitu-action), [Selection](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#select), [Move](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#move), [Rotate](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#rotate), [Scale](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#scale) and [Mirror](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/model-processing#mirror).

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Interface
content: The toolbar in the Support interface includes [Magic Support](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/support/magic-support), [Support Group](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/user-interface/toolbar#support-group) and [Selection Tools](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/user-interface/toolbar#selection-tools).

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Group
content: Group your supports by model and type for easier management. This makes it easy to preview all support details quickly and batch edit or delete supports.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Selection Tools
content: You can use different tools to select areas of your model for support addition, or to select added supports for editing or deletion. Five selection tools are available: Brush, Line, Rectangle, Polygon, and Free Curve.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Component List
content: All loaded files will be displayed in the Component List. You can select multiple files or click on the select all button to pick all files. The Check Box Icon lets you to select the file. The Invert Selection Icon lets you invert-select the file. The Ruler Icon lets you to turn on displaying the enclosure size of all models. The Add Icon  lets you add files. You can also double click on blank space of the list to add a file. The Delete Icon lets you delete the selected file. The Eye Icon lets you hide a file.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice Panel
content: The slice panel is located in the bottom right corner of the main interface. It includes slice settings, slice modes, and single/multi-parameter slicing buttons.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice Settings
content: Open the [slice settings](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/printer-management/printer-configuration) for the currently selected printer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slice Mode
content: Choose between single parameter or multi-parameter [slice mode](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/slice/slice-mode). If the selected printer does not support multi-parameter slicing, this option will be unavailable.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Single/Multi-Parameter Slicing
content: Click this button to slice the project and enter the [slice preview](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/slice/slice-preview) interface.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Gadgets
content: We will introduce some useful gadgets in CHITUBOX Pro in this chapter.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Information Panel
content: Information Panel is located at the bottom left corner of the main window, providing brief information for current settings.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Machine Management Bar
content: Machine Management Bar is located at the bottom of the main window, where you can add, delete and copy machines. Click the Add Machine button to add a new machine. Click the icon next to a machine, you will see the  Hide Platform/Grid, Copy Machine and Delete Machine options.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Support Display Mode
content: Click 'Support' on the Function Menu to switch to the support view. There are three buttons allowing you to switch to different support display modes. Clickl the [linl](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/chitubox-pro/latest/user-interface/gadgets#support-display-mode) to learn more details

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Render Mode
content: Render Mode is located on the top right corner of the main window, including two mode: Detail and Shadow modes. More model details are shown under Detail Mode. Model surfaces appear smoother under Shadow Mode.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: View Cube
content: View Cube is located on the top right corner of the main window, providing quick ways to manipulate the view angle or perspective, in order to check relative positions between objects. The  icon and Perspective / Orthographic icons are located on the top right corner of the main window next to View Cube. The Home View icon allows users to reset the view to the default view. The Perspective/Orthographic icons allow users to switch between perspective view and Orthographic view mode. The perspective view mode provides a more realistic scene, whereas the orthographic view mode provides plans views for a scene, allowing for easy evaluation of the relative positions between objects on the platform and making adjustments accordingly.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Slider
content: Slider is located on the right side of the main window. It is used to preview the cross sectional areas of models (pre-slice), and layers of models (post-slice). You can move the slider block to observe every part or layer of the model along the z-axis. You can also expand the x-axis and y-axis sliders by clicking the 'X' and 'Y' icons above the slider, allowing the observation of cross sections along the x and y axes. Pre-Slice: There are two buttons above and below the slicer to run animation of moving the slider positions. Clicking the Reset button at the bottom returns the slider to the original positions. The Slider component can help users evaluate model quality before sending it to the printer and adjust as needed. Post-Slice: Layer number will be displayed on top of the slider post-slice. Entering a layer number will bring up the exact layer.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Magnifier
content: After model slicing, a Magnifier too will be available below the slice preview window. You can set the magnification scale upon clicking the Magnifier icon. Move the pointer to the slice preview to magnify certain parts of the layer to check for slice quality and details.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Frequently Asked Questions
content: Click [here](https://manual.chitubox.com/en-US/faq/latest/chitubox-pro-faq) to view CHITUBOX Pro FAQ.

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Technical Support
content: We suggest that you join our [Discord User Group](https://discord.gg/t595GxfUnT), where global CHITUBOX Pro users and our tech support can communicate with each other. You can raise questions, share experiences and skills. You can also send questions to support@chitubox.com

name: CHITUBOX Pro
title: Advanced Tutorials
content: Visit the CHITUBOX Learning Center to view more [advanced tutorials](https://www.chitubox.com/en/academy/advanced).
